title: PlayStation State Of Play November 2025: All The Biggest Announcements And Games
description: By     Jason Fanelli   on November 11, 2025 at 3:15PM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from...
body:
By 
    Jason Fanelli
   on November 11, 2025 at 3:15PM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                Just when many of us thought gaming news livestreams were done for the year, PlayStation surprised its fans with the announcement of State of Play Japan.The 40-minute presentation was "packed with great games, interviews, and new looks at anticipated titles" from "beloved series to distinctive indie creations," according to Sony's official announcement. Games featured during the event included Elden Ring Nightreign, Marvel Tokon: Fighting Heroes, Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake, and Gran Turismo 7.Read below for all of the biggest announcements from the latest State of Play.Dragon Quest VII ReimaginedThe State of Play kicked off with a new look at Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, a full remake of the classic Square Enix RPG. The gameplay trailer showed off battle scenes, multiple characters, and revealed a February 5, 2026 release date.Inkonbini: One Store, Many StoriesNext came InKonbini: One Store, Many Stories, a cozy simulation game where players will run a Japanese corner store, or konbini. InKonbini is set to launch in April.Coffee Talk TokyoCoffee Talk Tokyo, the next installment in Toge Productions's Coffee Talk franchise, was revealed next. A brief glimpse at some of the patrons of this new coffee shop was coupled with a March 5 release date.Brokenlore Unfollow and AscendTwo entries in the Brokenlore horror franchise were shown next. Brokenlore Unfollow is set to launch in January, while Brokenlore Ascend is scheduled for Summer 2026.Fatal Frame: Crimson Butterfly 2 RemakeSticking with horror, Koei Tecmo Games presented a new look at the upcoming Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly remake. The game is set to launch on March 12.Gran Turismo 7Along with the SPEC III update announced earlier this year, the Gran Turismo 7 Power Pack will add even more content to the game this December, including a 24-hour race.No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium FilesFollowing its launch on Nintendo Switch and PC earlier this year, No Sleep For Kaname Date, the latest in the AI: The Somnium Files series, will launch on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 on February 26.Tokyo Xtreme RacerOn the same day, a new entry in the Tokyo Xtreme Racer racing series will arrive on PlayStation for the first time in 20 years.Bandai Namco DLCNever Grave: The Witch and the CurseNever Grave: The Witch and the Curse is a Metroidvania-style adventure game from Frontside 180 and Pocketpair Publishing. A long gameplay trailer was accompanied by an interview with development director Yasuomi Sakai.BlazBlue: Entropy Effect XNext up was Arc System Works and the debut of BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X. This sequel to 2023's Entropy Effect will once again feature characters from the BlazBlue fighting game franchise in a sprawling adventure when it launches on February 26.Octopath Traveler 0A new gameplay trailer for Octopath Traveler 0 aired next, showing off more of the game's HD-2D visuals and flashy battles. It included new characters Herminia, Tytos, and Auguste, as well as a village-building mechanic in which the player places houses, crops, and more. A demo containing the first three hours of the game is also available starting today.Marvel Tokon: Fighting SoulsNext up came Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls, for which Arc System Works announced a second closed beta test during the first week of December. The beta will introduce Ghost Rider and Spider-Man to the playable roster, along with two new stages, X-Mansion and Savage Land.Elden Ring Nightreign: The Forsaken HollowsA trailer for a new downloadable update for Elden Ring Nightreign, The Forsaken Hollows, aired next, with multiple new enemies and areas featured. The update launches December 4.PlayStation Gaming MonitorThe final announcement of the event was the reveal of a new PlayStation-branded 27-inch gaming monitor, which features 240hz refresh rate and a built-in charging mount for DualSense controllers.

title: Marvel Rivals Season 5 Finally Adds Rogue And Gambit
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Marvel Rivals Season 5 is a...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Marvel Rivals Season 5 is a formal celebration with the wedding of one of Marvel's most iconic couples. The season adds X-Men's Gambit and Rogue, and developer NetEase has released a new cinematic trailer to tease the couple's big wedding as well as some new costumes players might expect in the Season 5 battle pass, some of which may be obtainable with Marvel Rivals codes.          Season 5: Love is a Battlefield arrives on November 14. As revealed in the trailer above, the season is themed around Gambit and Rogue's wedding, but the ceremony is interrupted by some sort of cosmic energy.Gambit is revealed to be the first of the two new characters arriving, and he'll be categorized as a Strategist who blends kinetic energy control with his iconic playing cards. This also means Rogue will likely make her appearance a few weeks after the season's launch.Later in the season, NetEase will introduce a new game mode. This is an 18v18 Conquest mode that will be played on the new Grand Garden map. There will also be a non-combat map added to Marvel Rivals. This new map is themed around New York City, and players will be able to go and hangout and emote in this dedicated space.Gameplay changes and big fixes are likely included as well. However, more Season 5 details and the full battle pass reveal should be coming soon.Most recently, Season 4's midseason update added Daredevil to the game's lineup of heroes. Last month, Marvel Rivals added the game's first-ever PvE mode, which was themed around Marvel Zombies.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Pokemon Pokopia Release Date, Trailer, Gameplay, And Everything Else We Know
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          For the better part of three...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                For the better part of three decades, Pokemon's creatures have been called upon by their human trainers to do battle with each other at their command. But in 2026, the Pokemon are finally going to have their own paradise in this world in Pokemon Pokopia.This upcoming cozy game isn't about Pokemon knocking the heck out of each other. Instead, the player can offer them the chance to live side-by-side in an environment that's been specifically tailored to their individual needs. There's no need to fight over anything, or even any need for a human to determine their destiny. Players may be guiding the actions of the Pokemon, but Pokopia will be built by a Ditto one brick at a time.When will Pokemon Pokopia be released?Pokemon Pokopia will be released on March 5, 2026. When the game was announced in September 2025, Pokemon Pokopia only had a vague 2026 release window. In November, Nintendo has formally announced that the game would be released just four short months later, in early March 2026.Pokemon Pokopia Trailers          Only the announcement trailer has been released to date, but there's not really a story in this game. Instead of placing a human at the center of the gameplay, Pokopia introduces a Ditto that uses its natural transformation abilities to pass itself off as a human. This Ditto isn't hiding its true nature from the other Pokemon, but its ability to have a human body with Pokemon skills will go a long way towards the shaping the landscape.Pokemon Pokopia PlatformsAlthough Pokemon Pokopia doesn't appear to be too visually taxing for either model of the Switch, it will be exclusive to Nintendo Switch 2. Players who only have the original Switch will have to upgrade before they can move into Pokopia.Pokemon Pokopia Story, Setting and CharactersDitto is the main character of Pokemon Pokopia, but the trailer confirms that other classic Pokemon--including Pikachu, Bulbasaur, Squirtle, and Charmander--will be drawn to Pokopia by the choices made by Ditto.There don't appear to be any outside threats in this game. And as long as the Pokemon feel taken care of, it looks like they're going to be very happy in their new home. As for Ditto, it's unclear if its human-facing appearance can be customized by gender. But it seems like a safe bet that there will be some customization options.Pokemon Pokopia GameplayThe gameplay looks like a cross between Minecraft, Animal Crossing, and Dragon Quest Builders. In the trailer, Ditto demonstrates the ability to mimic the powers of other Pokemon to make grass grow or retrieve raw materials to craft objects and dwellings. Ditto can build homes for the Pokemon, transform the landscape, and even divert water to the area for a waterfall and ponds.Ditto can also grow crops and cook food for the Pokemon, and the trailer indicates that other player characters will also be able to visit the home you've made for yourself in the game.Pokemon Pokopia Development NewsPokemon Pokopia is being developed by Omega Force, the studio behind the Dynasty Warrior franchise, Persona 5 Strikers, and Fire Emblem Warriors. Omega Force has also had a lot of success working with Nintendo on the Legend of Zelda spin-offs Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment.For now, it's unknown if Pokemon Pokopia will receive any post-launch DLC from Omega Force after the game's release in March 2026.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
